intro: Purdiaea velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides. Purdiaea velutina is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to thrive in various environments.
